name: Will Ferrell
religion: Ferrell is a self-proclaimed atheist and loves poking fun at religion and the religious.
politicalViews: Ferrell is a supporter of Democrats and enjoys satirizing Republicans and conservatives in his comedic roles.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Will Ferrell was born and raised in Irvine, California.

There is no indication of Ferrell's religious upbringing, if there was one, and the only hard evidence of his current sentiments toward religion are on his MySpace page, where he calls himself an atheist.

It comes as no surprise though. Much of Ferrell's comedy revolves around skewering religion and religious people. Whether it makes fun of the rapture-happy, apocalypseprophesying fundamentalist Christians of America

content.sourceTitle: Will Ferrell Attached to Semi-Religious Comedy Swear To God
content.text: or satirizing those who claim to have seen God,
Ferrell is pretty good at making fun.

content.sourceTitle: Has Comedian Will Ferrell Forsaken America's Christians
content.text: [Talladega Nights] is a racist, bigoted work that ridicules southern, white Christian males. In one scene, the filmmakers sneeringly deride Southern Christians who say prayers to Jesus before dinner. The southern Christians come off as ignorant buffoons, and the figure of Jesus is a symbol ripe for condescending mockery.

content.sourceTitle: Will Ferrell's Federal Campaign Contribution Report
content.text: First of all, Ferrell is a Democrat. He made one political contribution in 2003 to Democratic presidential candidate Howard Dean.

But more to the point, he loves trashing Republicans. His rendition of George W. Bush was a major hit, presumably for painting the president as a clueless, bumbling buffoon. But it wasn't just comedy for Ferrell. He snubbed invitations to the White House during the Bush years, saying:

I had a couple of opportunities to go and meet [President Bush], and I declined, partly out of comedic purposes, because when I was on the show at the time, it didn't make sense to really meet the people that you play, for fear of them influencing you. And then the other side of it is, from a political standpoint, I don't want to meet that guy.
